skill.description: Comprehensive quality verification and validation through static analysis, dynamic testing, integration validation, and certification gates
skill.summary: Comprehensive quality verification and validation through static analysis, dynamic testing, integrat...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing no executable code. It describes how to orchestrate quality verification using standard testing tools (SonarQube, ESLint, Jest, Cypress, Playwright) through documentation and procedural guides. All documented commands are for legitimate development testing purposes.

content.value_statement: Manual quality checks are slow and inconsistent. This skill orchestrates comprehensive 5-phase quality verification with automated gates, ensuring every build meets production standards before deployment.
actual_capabilities: Run static analysis with SonarQube, ESLint, and complexity metrics
Execute unit, integration, and E2E tests with coverage tracking
Validate API contracts and service health (PostgreSQL, Redis, RabbitMQ)
Calculate certification score with weighted quality gates
limitations: Requires existing test infrastructure (Jest, Cypress, Playwright)
Depends on external tools (SonarQube, ESLint, jscpd) being installed
Does not fix issues automatically - only identifies and reports them

use_cases.title: Automate quality gates in CI/CD
use_cases.description: Integrate quality verification into GitHub Actions or GitLab CI pipelines to block releases that fail standards

use_cases.title: Comprehensive test reporting
use_cases.description: Run multi-phase verification and generate certification reports for compliance audits and stakeholder reviews

use_cases.title: Track code quality trends
use_cases.description: Monitor maintainability index, complexity, and coverage metrics over time to improve codebase health

prompt_templates.title: Quick verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Run quality verification on this codebase. I want to see static analysis, test results, and a certification score.

prompt_templates.title: Pre-release check
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute full quality certification for release. Include all compliance checks, API contract validation, and generate the certification report.

prompt_templates.title: Integration focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Run integration validation only. Check service health, API contracts, and cross-component data flow between cart, payment, order, and fulfillment services.

prompt_templates.title: Regression analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Run comprehensive quality verification and compare results with the last build. Highlight any regressions in coverage, complexity, or maintainability index.

output_examples.input: Run quality verification on my e-commerce codebase
output: Sign-off: QA, Security, Performance, Compliance approved

best_practices: Run quality verification on every pull request to catch issues early
Set certification threshold to 80 and fail builds below this score
Track certification trends over time to identify quality degradation
Address failing tests and high-complexity code within 24 hours
anti_patterns: Skipping verification to meet deadline pressures
Lowering thresholds instead of improving code quality
Ignoring flaky tests that mask real failures
Running verification only before releases (too late to fix)

faq.question: What tools does this skill integrate with?
faq.answer: SonarQube, ESLint, TypeScript, Jest, Cypress, Playwright, Pact, TestContainers, Newman, and curl for health checks.

faq.question: How long does full verification take?
faq.answer: Approximately 35-45 minutes: 10 min static analysis, 15 min dynamic testing, 10 min integration, 5 min certification, 5 min reporting.

faq.question: Can I run individual verification phases?
faq.answer: Yes. Use npm run verify:static, verify:testing, verify:integration, verify:certification, or verify:report for specific phases.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill only runs local analysis tools. Code is processed locally and never sent to external services.

faq.question: What if tests fail during verification?
faq.answer: Verification continues and generates a full report. If certification score drops below 80, the build is marked as failed.

faq.question: How does this compare to code-review-assistant?
faq.answer: Code-review-assistant focuses on human-readable code review feedback. This skill provides automated testing, metrics, and certification suitable for CI/CD gates.
